title: UX Designer
description:
About us

We’re The Very Group and we’re here to help families get more out of life. We know that our customers work hard for their families and have a lot to balance in their busy lives. That’s why we combine amazing brands and products with flexible payment options on Very.co.uk to help them say yes to the things they love. We’re just as passionate about helping our people get more out of life too, building careers with real growth, a sense of purpose, belonging and wellbeing.

About the team
The Digital Customer Experience (DCX) tribe is striving to create a world class customer experience across our Mobile and Web platforms. We are in control of building this exciting future and are looking for like-minded individuals to help make this a reality. We need people with strong backgrounds in digital retail to help us on this journey as we strive to define, design, build and run frictionless experiences that sets The Very Group apart from other online retailers

About the Role

With a... big ambition and millions of our loyal customers using the experiences we create every day; design plays a huge part in what we do at The Very Group (and rightly so!).

We are looking for an experienced UX Designer who can push boundaries, create great accessible experiences based on deep customer insight and disrupt the way we do things today.
• You will help bring our digital strategy to life, contribute to our Design System and be the voice of all things Design in one of our product squads.
• You will work in a collaborative hybrid environment, working closely with your cross-functional team of UX researchers, Product Managers, Engineers, Data Analysts, BAs, Testers and Delivery leads
• You will be involved in the end-to-end designs for the squad initiatives, shaping the vision and influencing roadmaps for your product area and facilitating discovery sessions with both your squad and the wider business.
• You will be responsible for overall design quality and outcomes within your area.
• You will also be joining a collaborative team of highly motivated design and research professionals from diverse backgrounds, who use their deep understanding of our customers to create seamless, accessible (WCAG 2.1 AA), and intuitive experiences that maximise customer value across the full end-to-end experience.

Day to day
• Partner with your product team and researcher on discovery that informs the squad vision, roadmaps, and priorities.
• Ground everything you do in a deep understanding of user needs, motivations, behaviours, accessibility, and performance measures.
• Collaborate with partners across the business to influence on UX best practices and ways of working.
• Spot opportunities for growth within our design capability and work with the UX Manager and team to drive forward solutions.
• For more experienced Designers, the opportunity to mentor and coach junior designers (including the opportunity of line management if aligned to career goals).

What you’ll bring
• Proven experience in UX design with a portfolio of work designing across platforms and devices
• A data and insight-driven mindset that works collaboratively and openly with our UX Research team
• Demonstratable experience of the techniques and artefacts needed to communicate and deliver an end-to-end product experience effectively (including personas, journey maps, wireframes, user flows, UI designs and prototypes etc)
• Ability to facilitate workshops, design sprints and other collaborative sessions
• Experience of working in a multivariate testing environment, getting work in front of customers so we can learn, iterate or pivot
• Collaboration with researchers, data analysts, product managers and developers to bring products to life through storytelling
• Ability to champion our UX/UI design principles and contribute to our Design system with a constant lens on accessibility and inclusive design

Some of our benefits
• Flexible, hybrid working model
• Inclusive culture and environment, check out our Glassdoor reviews
• Flexible benefits allowance to suit your needs
• 30 days holiday + bank holidays
• Udemy learning platform
• Bonus potential (performance and business-related)
• Up to 25% discount on Very.co.uk
• Matched pension up to 6%
• More benefits can be found on our career site

How to apply

Please note that the talent acquisition team are managing this vacancy directly, and if successful in securing this role, you may be required to undertake a credit, CIFAS and CRB check.

What happens next?

Our talent acquisition team will be in touch if you’re successful so keep an eye on your emails! We’ll arrange a short call to learn more about you, as well as answer any questions you have. If it feels like we’re a good match, we’ll share your CV with the hiring manager to review, and then be in touch to move to the interview process. Our interview process is tailored to each role and can be in-person and remotely. We will always look to make the adjustments you need to bring your best self to interview.

Equal opportunities

We’re an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accomodate

title: UI/UX Designer and 3D Artist
description:
Benefits
£26,000 - £30,000 depending on experience.
Liverpool office.
20 holidays + bank holidays.
Sometimes we will take you and the rest of the team on trips to Barcelona and Prague to meet with our clients at expo’s.
We ask all of our employees to use the first 45 minutes of their working day for learning and self development. We’ll pay for any online courses for you to do during this time, as well as paying for any talks or conferences that you would like to attend.

About Us
We are an ambitious Liverpool based media agency, creating bespoke websites and producing videos and social media content for our clients in the hydroponics industry and with brands that have an excellent social corporate responsibility strategy. We’re looking to expand our work with larger businesses.

Summary
We are looking for a confident cross discipline designer who is prepared to throw themselves into a range of design challenges. You will take responsibility for the UI and UX of our clients' websites... and work closely with our developer to ensure they get built as you intend. You will represent the users you are designing for to ensure you deliver the best websites for our clients and their users. You will also be responsible for delivering motion graphics to our video team when required. Ocassionaly producing still and animated 3D product renders for our clients. We are a small team, working on videos and social media campaigns as well as websites. Because of this, you may be required to help designers with branding and print design on occasion.

Responsibilities
Produce still and animated product renders for use on clients websites and social media. This may require 3D modelling at times. Blender experience necessary.
Translating client website briefs into proposals. Working with the Director and Developer to price up proposals.
Conceptualising user experiences with user flows and wireframes. Conceptualising user interfaces using Figma or Adobe XD and presenting them to clients for sign off. Experience producing animated mockups with After Effects is a bonus.
Producing pixel perfect, responsive user interfaces across desktop, tablet and mobile breakpoints on Figma to handover to the Developer.
Using analytics and running user tests to see if the solution you have designed meets the needs of its users.
Main point of contact for our web clients.

Flexible hours
40 hours per week, including 1 hour per day for lunch. Work these hours whenever you like. Prefer a lie in? Just start later and finish later. More of an early bird? Start work at 7am if you want an early finish. Or if you’d rather a day off in the week, then you’re free to make the time up at the weekend, it’s completely up to you.
You must be able to commute to our Liverpool office. Most of our staff work several days in the office each week and several at home, but we are flexible on this.

Skills required
Proficiency in Figma or Adobe XD, with a willingness to learn Figma.
Understanding of a user centred design approach and proficiency in; user flows, wireframes (hand drawn or on Figma), user testing,
Solid understanding of typography, spacing, colour theory (including accessibility for web) and responsive design.
3D modelling and rendering with Blender/Cinema 4D.
Proficiency with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop.
Knowledge of HTML and CSS in order to communicate effectively with developers.

What we’re looking for
We’re looking for someone with experience leading web design projects, who knows their way around Figma and has a good eye for detail. You need to be comfortable talking to clients and working with developers. You should also have experience producing animated 3D renders. You should be well organised and able to manage your time well while juggling UI design projects with 3D render creation simultaneously.
You must be self motivated and well organised, and a good communicator. You will be comfortable presenting your work to clients and able to take feedback on board.

To apply
Send us your CV and a portfolio of your work.

• Monday to Friday

Ideally you will be based in the Greater Manchester and happy to come into the office a couple of days per week! But we appreciate that things have changed and flexibility is at the top of everyone's agenda, so if you would rather be remote please let us know.

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you.

title: User Experience (UX) Designer
description:
User Experience (UX) Designer Macclesfield Closing Date : 16th December 2022* Competitive salary & benefits on offer. Do you have expertise in, and passion for UX Design?

Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines?

If so, AstraZeneca might be the one for you!*About astrazeneca*AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world's most serious disease.

But we're more than one of the world's leading pharmaceutical companies.At AstraZeneca we're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work.

Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and spark your entrepreneurial spirit. There's no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society.

An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth... and development.

About our it team*Here our work has a direct impact on patients - redefining our ability to develop life-changing medicines.

We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining pioneering science with leading digital technology platforms and data.

All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more. Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise.

Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth.

Focused and committed, and backed with the investment to succeed, we're driving cross-company change to disrupt the entire industry.

Ours is a place to innovate, take ownership and run with it. You're trusted to explore and to find new solutions, experimenting with pioneering technology and grappling with challenges in a modern technology environment that might never have been taken on before.

It's a dynamic and challenging environment to work in - but that's why we like it. There are countless opportunities to learn and grow, whether that's exploring new technologies in hackathons, or transforming the roles and work of colleagues, forever.

Shape your own path, with support all the way. Diverse minds that work cross-functionally and inclusively together. Be part of a team that has the backing to innovate, redefine an industry and change lives.

WHY JOIN US?*We're a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There's a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that's unique to AstraZeneca - it allows us to dive deep intoexploring new pioneering technology.

We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science.

We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification.

We're not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent - we speak up, think creatively and share ideas.

Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate,and an appreciation for high standards.

It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact.

Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors!*The mid-level UX Designer is responsible for designing products & services, from user insights, that are easy and delightful to use.

These products and services will include both external (patient- and / or doctor-facing) and internal colleague-facing tools, and cover a range of platforms (devices, websites, mobile apps, etc.

We are looking for someone who has experience across the full, end-to-end UCD process, not just an 'expert designer'.You will work with experienced researchers and / or carry out qualitative / quantitative user research studies (e.

g. user interviews or observation) yourself. You will use the outputs of this research to inform the early design process;

for example, creating personas or user journey maps.Using the available insights, you will design the product's high-level UX (e.

g., via flows and wireframes), plus lower-level interaction designs (e.g., via interactive prototypes) which unambiguously describe the product experience.

The focus is on usability, not aesthetics.You will iteratively improve your designs based on results from usability testing (carried out by yourself or others).

You will work closely with technical developers during the build process to manage compromises and ensure the best possible UX is launched.

You will find ways to measure and prove the value that your research and design interventions have made.As well as the tactical side of UX Design and Research, the role also includes a more strategic side.

You will support the Head of UX and the UX Leads in evangelizing the benefits of UX / UCD across AZ, using a set of excellent case studies where UCD has made a measurable difference to business performance.

You will help to develop new business for yourself and the wider UX team. You will also support training non-UX colleagues into UX / UCD methods.

If you are not already an experienced user researcher, you will be supported in improving these skills.Please note : this is not a Visual Design or 'UI' role;

the core skills and experience required are very much 'UX'.*Requirements (Technical) Degree-level qualification (preferably postgraduate) in Ergonomics, Human Factors, Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design or a related relevant field* Understanding of UX principles, both from academic learning and on-the-job experience* Real-world experience as a UX Practitioner in an industrial (not just academic) environment - working either in or for large, client-side companies* Experience or practical understanding across UX Research methodologies - e.

g. interviews, surveys, usability testing, field trials - and how they fit into a full UCD process. (Direct experience moderating such research is preferred but not essential).
• Experience using research insights to make design decisions, and in creating strategic design documents such as Personas, User Journey Maps and Storyboards.
• Experience creating high-level information architectures, low-level flows and wireframes, interaction designs, interactive prototypes, etc.
• Experience with UX design and interactive prototyping tools (e.g. Figma, Sketch, InVision, Axure, Adobe XD)* Experience designing for mobile (web and apps), with up-to-date knowledge of UX / Interaction Design patterns for iOS and Android.

Also experience working across digital channels, including fixed-web and tablet too.* Strong analytic skills; comfortable working with big, complex, numerical data* A portfolio of case studies where good UCD has made a measurable (quantitative) difference to the quality of digital products and services* Experience or exposure to Accessibility / Inclusive Design - i.

e. ensuring the best experience for all users, independent of their (dis)ability - would be nice to have* Experience working with pharmaceutical / medical products and services is not essential but would be nice to have* Experience in Behavioural Science or Psychology is not essential but would be nice to have*Requirements (Soft Skills) A self-starter, not requiring handholding.
• The energy and pro-activity to develop relationships and new business opportunities for yourself and the wider UX team* An active member of the external UX community, with an interest in sharing and keeping up with the state-of-the-art in design tools and research methods* An excellent listener, with the ability to quickly filter the relevant user insights for design* An excellent presenter, succinctly imparting UX designs, with appropriate rationale, in both written and spoken formats, and in plain, non-technical, language* Great influencing skills, including the ability to evangelize UCD to stakeholders* A great team player, able to work well as part of a small UX team and collaborate closely with Product Managers, Business Analysts, Technical Developers, etc.
• Motivated to both give and receive constructive criticism on UX designs* Able to successfully juggle the competing demands of multiple concurrent projects within a global corporate environment.
